The (hopefully) long awaited teaser of my new craft is finally here. I have gone through all different kinds of concepts before going back to the roots - and I mean way back.

This, isn't it - this is my old submission for the previous season:

This is what it has evolved into, following the championship - reborn as an exploration rover/utility vehicle:

And this is a Teaser of my newest incarnation:

Evolution of a vehicle I was planning to submit a gigantic radish-shaped racecar but it just didn't have the maneuverability or the acceleration I wanted. I went through all kinds of crazy crafts until I came full circle back to these. And it seems to have worked.
I must say, it's quite pretty. You don't need the lights, they create drag so I think it'd be wise to remove them.

Teaser:

NOTE: This version was not quite legal, the problem has since been fixed.

Fair enough, I thought it would be good to have a Dakar-Lighting Option in. For fun, I am testing it with 2 large control surfaces. It looks even better if I'm honest. What would it take for you to reconsider the rules and allow adding a large surface on the back as well as the front OR splitting them into equivalent amount of small control surfaces?

I'm not a big fan of the large rear wing. I prefer a small rear and a slightly wider front, hence the use of two, spaced apart at the front and clipped together at the rear. Next season there'll be a Monaco-esque circuit where you will be permitted to use a large rear and 1 more small at the front and back, for maximum downforce.

[Edit] I see sidepods, DisarmingBaton5! Nice!
